subject: "Sunday Morning" Child soldiers
body:
Home | U.S. | World | Politics | SciTech | Health | Entertainment | Business | Opinion | Sports | Blogs | Interactives | Video 

  The Early Show | CBS Evening News | 48 Hours | 60 Minutes | The Saturday Early Show | CBS Sunday Morning | Face The Nation 






June 3, 2007
 
Every year 
      thousands of children die in wars all over the world. Most are innocent 
      bystanders, but a growing number of them are soldiers, impressed into 
      service by guerrilla and government armies alike. Ishmael Beah was one of 
      those child soldiers and is the author of a best-selling book that 
      describes his life as a fighter in Sierra 
      Leone’s civil war. He speaks with Harry 
      Smith for our Sunday Morning Cover Story. 
      
 
This year 
      marks yet another milestone in the lives of baby boomers… It was 40 years 
      ago, that’s right, 40…when a radical movement was born in San Francisco’s 
      Haight- Ashbury district which made the word “hippie” a part of our 
      vernacular -- and changed our world. Correspondent John Blackstone 
      remembers the “Summer of Love.” 
 
Our technology 
      correspondent Daniel Sieberg tells us that the spirit of experimentation 
      that made the Bay area famous in the 1960s is alive and well – as he 
      visits the annual “Maker Faire.” It’s a place where artists and inventors 
      from all over the country are free to “think outside the box” … displaying 
      an array of products that boggle the imagination.  
 
Talk radio is 
      informative, controversial and -- as many stations across the country have 
      found out -- a real crowd pleaser. And actor Liev Schreiber is pleasing 
      crowds on Broadway as well in the play Talk Radio. Tracy Smith profiles 
      the man many are calling the best actor of his generation.  
 
Finally, Bill 
      Geist finds out what it means to be a real celebrity as he spends the 
      day with the most revered trophy in professional sports… pro hockey’s 
      Stanley Cup.
 
Those stories, and more, this Sunday 
      Morning.  Listen 
      for the trumpet.
